go after something/somebody.translation[: to follow or chase someone or something because you want to catch them
Joe went after her to make sure she was unhurt.
I can’t decide whether to go after the job or not.
to try to obtain something, such as a new job, a business contract etc
Sega plans to go after the core of the video game playing market — children eight to 12 years old.
to take actions to punish someone who has done something wrong or illegal
Rules are needed to go after brokers who sell unsuitable investments.
